org.json.stream

Class JSONObjectBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.json.stream.JSONObjectBuilder

  • public final class JSONObjectBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builds a JSON object model using events supplied from JSONStreamReader. This uses less stack space than parsing via JSONTokener, since only one stack frame is allocated per nested object or array.

    A simple example of how to use this class:

     JSONObject jsonObject = JSONObjectBuilder.buildJSONObject(JSON_TEXT);

    • Method Detail

      • buildJSONValue

        public static java.lang.Object buildJSONValue(java.io.Reader reader)
                                       throws JSONException
        Build a JSON value from a Reader. The value may be one of:
        • JSONObject.NULL
        • Boolean.TRUE or Boolean.FALSE
        • A Double, Long, Integer, BigDecimal, or BigInteger
        • A String
        • A JSONObject
        • A JSONArray
        Parameters:
        reader - A reader.
        Returns:
        a JSON value of the type defined above
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • buildJSONValue

        public static java.lang.Object buildJSONValue(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                              java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
                                       throws JSONException
        Build a JSON value from a InputStream and supplied Charset. The value may be one of:
        • JSONObject.NULL
        • Boolean.TRUE or Boolean.FALSE
        • A Double, Long, Integer, BigDecimal, or BigInteger
        • A String
        • A JSONObject
        • A JSONArray
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the input stream containing the JSON data
        charset - the character set with which to interpret the input stream
        Returns:
        a JSON value of the type defined above
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • buildJSONValue

        public static java.lang.Object buildJSONValue(JSONStreamReader reader)
                                       throws JSONException
        Build a JSON value from a JSONStreamReader. The value may be one of:
        • JSONObject.NULL
        • Boolean.TRUE or Boolean.FALSE
        • A Double, Long, Integer, BigDecimal, or BigInteger
        • A String
        • A JSONObject
        • A JSONArray

        The reader must be at the beginning of the document.

        Parameters:
        reader - A source stream reader.
        Returns:
        a JSON value of the type defined above
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • buildObjectSubTree

        public static JSONObject buildObjectSubTree(JSONStreamReader reader)
                                     throws JSONException
        If the given JSONStreamReader's ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.OBJECT, return the entire subtree as a JSONObject value. This method advances the parser onto the JSONStreamReader.ParseState.END_OBJECT state.

        If the JSON stream is not parseable as an object, a JSONException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        reader - A source stream reader.
        Returns:
        a JSONObject representing the subtree starting at the current OBJECT state
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • buildArraySubTree

        public static JSONArray buildArraySubTree(JSONStreamReader reader)
                                   throws JSONException
        If the given JSONStreamReader's ParseState was JSONStreamReader.ParseState.ARRAY, return the entire subtree as a JSONArray value. This method advances the parser onto the JSONStreamReader.ParseState.END_ARRAY state.

        If the JSON stream is not parseable as an array, a JSONException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        reader - A source stream reader.
        Returns:
        a JSONArray representing the subtree starting at the current ARRAY state
        Throws:
        JSONException
